page.title: 11WEST COKER AREA TRANSPORT
page.content: {A "30" TRUNK ROAD THE A30 MAIN ROAD GOES THROUGH THE VILLAGES OF WEST COKER AND EAST CHINNOCK.A COUNT OF VEHICLES SHOWED 420 IN 1 HOUR TO AND FROM YEOVIL, CARS,VANS AND HEAVY GOODS VEHICLES. IT CAN BE MUCH BUSIER AT PEAK PERIODS. BECAUSE THE A 30 IS SUCH A BUSY AND NARROW ROAD THROUGH WEST COKER A BY_ PASS HAS BEEN PLANNED. THIS HAS BEEN UNDER DISCUSSION SINCE 1934. THE LATEST PLAN IS TO BUILD A NEW ROAD JOINING THE EXISTING ROAD AT ROUNDABOUTS 1 MILE WEST OF THE VILLAGE AND AT COKER BRIDGE TO THE EAST. THE ESTIMATED COST IS ABOUT Â£3,000,000 THIS WOULD MAKE THE VILLAGE MUCH SAFER & MOST PEOPLE FAVOUR THIS BUT OTHERS FEAR IT WILL AFFECT THEIR BUISNESS.IT WOULD ALSO AFFECT THE OWNER OF BARTON FARM WHOSE LAND WOULD BE USED FOR THE ROAD.
